intro: Gonolobus fuscoviolaceus, commonly known as the purple-veined morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from purple to violet. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and clearings. Gonolobus fuscoviolaceus is a climbing vine that can grow up to several meters in length.
